Action.author: c0rwin
Action.body: I'd agree w/ ~yacovm and this is not being used in production code, but for testing purposes only. However I do share your concerns ~ashutosh_kumar , therefore I'd put #review-needed as to take this out and refactor the code might require significant amount of changes, therefore would like other maintainer to weight it on how important it is to take care for v1.0.

Action.author: mastersingh24
Action.body: I don't think this poses any risk or threat and my take is that we defer this for a later date

Action.author: christopherferris
Action.body: Then we need to document the exception in the AST scan.

Action.author: c0rwin
Action.body: ~ashutosh_kumar Can you please fill the exception in AST scan as suggested above?

Action.author: ashutosh_kumar
Action.body: ~C0rWin , I am not sure about exception process. Will check with ~ChristopherFerris . I have changed fixed version field to 1.1.

Action.author: yacovm
Action.body: can we reduce this severity to medium?

Action.author: denyeart
Action.body: ~C0rWin Are you still intending to work on this one?

Action.author: c0rwin
Action.body: ~denyeart as far as I understand this is not an issue and ~ashutosh_kumar supposed to fill and exception, since the code used to testing and not for production use. As a matter of fact I think this ticket could be closed.

Action.author: denyeart
Action.body: Ok, I will go ahead and close. ~ashutosh_kumar Please re-open if you think some code fix is needed.
